bPIWOx-y6.memHandModelNotes:
expand forest Mus by 60m to include roads and other open gaps in continuous forest.  Then create a mask of forested areas >165 ha. To id habitat as areas that are > 165 forest.  This seems to be based on the home range size of Pileateds.
I changed this model to include AMUs such as developed open space, successional habitats and other anthropogenic map units, then applied buffer of 60m, and then set the patch size to 165ha. I removed hand model check based on new model approach. MJR 3jan07.

bPIWOx-y5.memHandModelNotes:
expand forest Mus by 60m to include roads and other open gaps in continuous forest.  Then create a mask of forested areas >165 ha. To id habitat as areas that are > 165 forest.  This seems to be based on the home range size of Pileateds.
I changed this model to include AMUs such as developed open space, successional habitats and other anthropogenic map units, then applied buffer of 60m, and then set the patch size to 165ha. I removed hand model check based on new model approach. MJR 3jan07.

references: Raley, Catherine M., and Keith B. Aubry. 2006. Foraging ecology of pileated woodpeckers in coastal forests of Washington. Journal of Wildlife Management 70(5):1266-1275.
Bull, Evelyn L. 1975. Habitat utilization of the pileated woodpecker, Blue Mountains, Oregon. M.S. Thesis, Oregon State Univ., Corvallis. 58 pp.

Layne, J.N.; Stallcup, J.A.; Woolfenden, G.E.; McCauley, M.N.; Worley, D.J.  1977. Fish and Wildlife Inventory of the Seven-County Region Included in the Central Florida Phosphate Industry Area-Wide Environmental Impact Study. Volumes I and II.  Also available as PB-278 457, Price codes: A99 in paper copy, A01 in microfiche. September 1977. Volume I - 643 p, 123 fig, 34 tab, Volume II - 635 p, 164 fig, 7 tab.

Nielsen-Pinus, N. 2005. Nest site selection, nest success, and density of selected cavity-nesting birds in northeastern Oregon with a method for improving accuracy of density estimates. M.S. Thesis. University of Idaho, Moscow.
Renken, R. B., and E. P. Wiggers. 1993. Habitat characteristics related to pileated woodpecker densities in Missouri. Wilson Bull. 105:77-83.
Bent, A.C. 1939. Life histories of North American woodpeckers, U.S. Nat'l. Mus. Bull. 174. Washington, D.C.
Mellen, T.K., E.C. Meslow, and R.W. Mannan. 1992. Summer time home range and habitat use of pileated woodpeckers in western Oregon. Journal of Wildlife Management 56:96-103.
Kilham, L..  1976. Winter foraging and associated behavior of Pileated Woodpeckers in Georgia and Florida. Auk 93: 15–24.
Kaufman K. 1996. Lives of North American Birds. Boston, New York: Houghton Mifflin Company.
Harestad, A. S., and D. G. Keisker. 1989. Nest tree use by primary cavity-nesting birds in south central British Columbia. Can. J. Zool. 67:1067-1073.
Potter, E. F., J. F. Parnell, and R. P. Teulings. 1980. Birds of the Carolinas. Univ. North Carolina Press, Chapel Hill. 408 pp.
Simpson M.B Jr. 1992. Birds of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Chapel Hill and London: University of North Carolina Press.
Bull, E.L. 1987. Ecology of the pileated woodpecker in northeastern Oregon. Journal of Wildlife Management 51:472-81.
Fussell, J. III and M. Lyons. 1990. Birds of the Outer Banks [pamphlet]. Eastern National Parks and Monument Association Coastal Wildlife Refuge Society.
Harrison, H.H. 1979. A field guide to western birds' nests. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 279 pp.
Bull, E. L. 1987. Capture techniques for owls. Pages 291-293 in Nero, R. W., et al., eds. Biology and conservation of northern forest owls. USDA Forest Service, Gen. Tech. Rep. RM-142.

McClelland, B.R. 1979. The pileated woodpecker in forests of the northern Rocky Mountains. Pages 283-299 in J.G. Dickson, R.N. Conner, R.R. Fleet, J.A. Jackson, and J.C. Kroll, editors. The role of insectivorous birds in forest ecosystems. Academic Press,

Mitchell, W.A. 1988. Songbird nest boxes. Section 5.1.8, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Wildlife Resources Management Manual. Tech. Rep. EL-88-19. Waterways Experiment Station, Vicksburg, Mississippi. 48 pp.
Hall, G.A. 1983. West Virginia birds:distribution and ecology. Spec. Publ. Carnegie Mus. Nat. Hist. No. 7, Pittsburgh. 180 pp.
Renken, R. B., and E. P. Wiggers. 1989. Forest characteristics related to pileated woodpecker territory size in Missouri. Condor 91:642-652.

Bull, Evelyn L., Nicole Neilsen-Pincus, Barbara C. Wales, and Jane L. Hayes. 2007. The influence of disturbance events on pileated woodpeckers in Northeastern Oregon. Forest Ecology and Management 243:320-329.
Harrison, H.H. 1975. A field guide to bird's nests in the U.S. east of the Mississippi River. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston, Massachusetts. 257 p.
Kilham, L. 1983. Life history studies of woodpeckers of eastern North America. Nuttall Ornithol. Club Pub. No. 20. vii + 240 pp.
